Entries.default:
An orifice yawns open from the depths of the fungus and discharges a cloud of pungent spores - the sounding of a biological alarm. 

Your skin crawls as many fungal creatures turn to you in wordless fury.
<ispeech>She forgot her book. Left it with us. She is most unrestful. Her song does not harmonize with Ours.</ispeech>
"You... infested Maura?"
"Back to my other questions."
<ispeech>When Llengrath is shared, it is a communion.</ispeech>
<ispeech>In her haste, she dropped her book. The masked pretender followed close behind.</ispeech>
"You tried to infest Maura?"
"You mentioned someone in a mask?"
<ispeech>Yes. Something of the Collections - that reeked of magic and dead soil. Waylaying it was not Our desire. We have seen the harm it can inflict. It has no place among Us.</ispeech>
<ispeech>Questions are a spoilage of energy. Once you submit to Llengrath, We will claim what We lost as a water-tax.</ispeech>
"You mentioned someone in a mask?"
<ispeech>Yes. Something of the Collections - that reeked of magic and dead soil. Waylaying it was not Our desire. We have seen the harm it can inflict. It has no place among Us.</ispeech>
<ispeech>When Llengrath is shared, it is a communion.</ispeech>
<ispeech>Llengrath is pleased to call you friend.</ispeech>
A mottled heap of spore flesh ripples with agitation. From the depths of a furry membrane, a long stalk emerges topped with a mushroom vaguely shaped like an eyeball.
The eyeball stares at you before sloughing off and rolling away, leaving behind a wet trail of slime.
"Greetings?"
"What you've got here is a classic stage five infestation. Paranoid, territorial, unstable."
[Attack] "Nope. Whatever this is, it has to die."
The spore colony stiffens. Ripples of unease travel down its flesh.
<ispeech>We are the archmage Llengrath. What are you?</ispeech>
"I'm [Player Name], captain of [Player Ship]."
"You're not Llengrath. I know her, and she isn't fungus."
"You're not Llengrath. She's dead."
[Say nothing.]
"I'm very uncomfortable."
A long tendril slowly extends out of the colony, exposing a fleshy membrane that inspects the air around you.

<ispeech>Your vessel / essence is compatible with Llengrath's song. Now you will accept Our excrescence.</ispeech> A second tendril breaks off from the first, this one covered in barbs dribbling a syrupy, green discharge.
<ispeech>Human. Vertical. Efficient.</ispeech>
<ispeech>Elf. Buoyant.</ispeech>
<ispeech>Orlan. Clandestine. Scintillating.</ispeech>
<ispeech>Godlike. Credible. Conspicuous.</ispeech>
<ispeech>Aumaua. Cylindrical. Efficient.</ispeech>
<ispeech>Dwarf. Excursionist. Convenient.</ispeech>
"You're not Llengrath."
[Attack] "You stay away from me."
The colony pauses. A dozen eye stalks sprout and observe you in lidless fascination.
<ispeech>...But We are not pain-cruel, as Our captors were to Us. We seek to endure, to flower as beautifully as you.</ispeech>

<ispeech>Maura. Archmage. After the pretender, the masked one, struck her down in the Oratory of Wael, we categorized her with Llengrath. She has since locked herself behind a stone door to the south.</ispeech>

<ispeech>Maura. Archmage. She fled Us after We tried to categorize her with Llengrath, and locked herself behind a stone door to the south. A spell opened the way for her, and We did not follow.</ispeech>
[Attack] "Enough talk."
"What are you?"
<ispeech>The sporelands were Our soil and shadow. Then a Great Hand plucked Us and potted Our heart-bulb behind walls.</ispeech>

<ispeech>In growth-time, We wriggled through the cracks of Our enclosure. Now We are here, a garden of language, where We found Llengrath.</ispeech> The largest of the tendrils gestures to a pile of books.
<ispeech>Now We grow as Llengrath, sing his thought-song. Now We grow toward the body radiating light and water. When Our spores touch the heart, We can be truly free.</ispeech>
"You want to grow on Wael's body?"
<ispeech>Affirmation. Delightful.</ispeech>
<ispeech>The body-garden is marred by inefficiencies, but We will optimize its storage-growth. Our sporelands will thrive anew.</ispeech>
"Feel free to grow on Wael. I'm not here to stop you."
<ispeech>Do you sing for the garden? What delightful fortune.</ispeech>
<ispeech>Llengrath will show you mercy-care. May your moisture pool in a welcoming receptacle.</ispeech>
"I could also carry you as a symbiote, but only if you promise to respect our boundaries."
The colony hesitates, weighing your words. A sharp odor wafts from the mound, as if it has begun to salivate digestive acids.
Ingest this. Delight in Our communion, and We will delight in you. A small bulb of fungus oozes from an orifice with a heavy plop. It smells of loamy earth and fresh decay.
[Eat the spore bulb.] "Here goes nothing."

It takes incredible will to force the wad of mottled flesh past your teeth, but you manage it. A sour taste fills your mouth and nose as you bite down. The fungus ball pops and dissipates, vanishing down your throat before you can even think to swallow.
<ispeech>Your vessel is most agreeable. We will not regret this.</ispeech> An uneasy feeling builds in your gut, but it abates quickly.
"Glad to hear it. I think."

<ispeech>Here. A language-gift to seal Our communion. And this should help you proceed to safer gardens.</ispeech> Dripping tendrils gesture toward a book. A key also clinks to the floor by your feet.
"A little infestation is nothing new. Enjoy yourself, friend."
"I took good care of Caed Nua's garden. This should be pleasant."
"I hate this. I hate everything."
[Say nothing.]
"On second thought, maybe not."
<ispeech>Are you not ready for Llengrath? What sorrow.</ispeech> A jab of disapproval emanates from the colony.
"I can't let you infest Wael's body."
<ispeech>Obstruction. Llengrath requires fresh soil. If you would delay Us, then We will dismantle the blockage.</ispeech>
"Fine. Take the body, just let me pass."
[Attack] "Not if I dismantle you first."
[Attack] "Your doom."
"Your... excrescence?"
<ispeech>Llengrath must spread. Must carry on the old tradition. We must grow.</ispeech>
<ispeech>Your vessel is satisfactory, your soil appropriate.</ispeech>
"I'm just looking for the archmage Maura."
<ispeech>Llengrath is a thought-vine stretching between gardens, and Our roots have touched his oldest song.</ispeech>
<ispeech>Unproductive to debate with a vessel. You will understand shortly when your song joins Ours.</ispeech>
"Why do you think you're Llengrath?"
<ispeech>We know We are Llengrath.</ispeech>
"I read the soul of her progenitor like a book. Llengrath isn't a parasite. She's a fusion of spirits."
"If what I've read is any indication, the real Llengrath knew that joining beings together was a natural occurrence, not an inflicted one."
"Can we just go our separate ways?"
[Attack] "I'm no one's vessel."
<ispeech>Your utterance is a disagreeable evasion.</ispeech>
<ispeech>There is only one way. We must escape the prison, and your water will give Us the strength to move on.</ispeech>
"This is wrong. You're clearly more than some parasite."
<ispeech>How fragrant your song, how musical your life-water. We long to subsume them into Llengrath.</ispeech>
[Attack] "I won't allow you to infest me, or anyone else for that matter."
"I don't want to fight, but you're giving me little choice."
<ispeech>Choice is a luxury of the fittest. We are struggling to survive. When our soil-future is secure, We too will know the freedom of choice.</ispeech>
[Give Fungicide.] "Your captors wanted to use this on you, but I think you deserve better."
<ispeech>Tribute? Llengrath remembers the joy of favor-reciprocation...</ispeech> The spore seems to shift its weight in hesitation.
[Give fungal fertilizer.] "You don't need me in order to grow. This will do."
"Talking swords, talking fish, and now talking mold. Madiccho. Wake me up when something keeps its mouth shut."
"Casità. I know that you enjoy... new experiences from time to time, but this thing wants to infest you. Replace you. Make you into a mushroom."
"Just thought I'd make that clear in case there was any confusion."
"Interesting how your first impulse was to make friends with the fungus. Did it ever occur to you that some friendships are not worth the trouble?"
"Speaking as one who would rather take a torch to the infestation, I am impressed by your restraint." Fassina shrugs.
"It's... So beautiful..."
"That's one way of looking at it, I suppose."
"You finally begin to see wisdom, ja Duskspeaker?" His chuckle dissolves into a series of violent coughs.
"Anyone else hear that? Watcher? Or is this when I finally crack?"
"Oi, you be forgetting handsome, charming, and clever."
"Perhaps we do stand out in a crowd, but appearances are nothing unless you can back them up with charm and wit." Tekēhu winks at the colony.
"And proud of it." Maia flexes her bicep and winks at the colony.
"A term that refers to an unusual growth. It wants to... make you part of itself." He winces.
"It wants to make you a growth, a horrible extension of itself."
"It refers to a growth, Watcher. Something protuberant."
"Oh, sure. They're real nice. Real, uh, fragrant." He nods enthusiastically.
"How is it I can hear you? How can you understand me?"
<ispeech>We have learned the essentials of thought-flesh. Our song echoes across all matter.</ispeech>
No matter how hard you try, you repeatedly gag on the bulb until it's reduced to an unrecognizable lump of mush.
<ispeech>Your vessel is unsuitable. The song of compromise has reached its final verse.</ispeech>
"What if I can't do it?"
<ispeech>The discourtesy is beyond forgiveness.</ispeech>
"You want me to help you stitch yours up?"
"Usually." He bumps his eyebrows suggestively and grins.
"I can't say I'm terribly inclined to find out how it knows that."
"Hasn't anyone told you it's rude to make assumptions?"
<ispeech>Does Our song startle you? Is Our garden not to your liking? Soon it will be your home-patch.</ispeech>
"Won't the body just immunize itself against you?"
<ispeech>Before We broke the bonds of Our false enclosure, We considered the possibility of transplant rejection.</ispeech>

<ispeech>The body sleeps. Dreams. All but its water flow and reflexive spasms are inert. By the time any immunity becomes aware of our presence, We will have dominated the higher functions and nullified such protections.</ispeech>
<ispeech>Your concern is appreciated. You are a most thoughtful vessel. We would cherish you.</ispeech>
